channel.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
channel.description: Models I add appear in my weapon slot. E.g SilentCJ's amazing staff capes. They appear in my weapon slot in-game. Can someone tell me what to do? Much appreciated. -David7147

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Well, you’re screwed, there must be something wrong, it can’t just ‘not work’.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“david7147, post:13, topic:322165”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=418586.msg3076366#msg3076366 date=1261863709]
That’s where you went wrong, error on your part you see.
Here are the ints.

if(i == 13672)  // change this if you need to "item number"
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 8741;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0;
class8.anInt174 = 14131;
class8.anInt181 = 1000;
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 14115;
class8.anInt200 = 14115;
class8.anInt164 = 14116;
class8.anInt188 = 14116;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = "Metallica t-shirt";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Yope.".getBytes();
}
if(i == 13677) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anInt174 = 14125; //Inv & Ground
class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 14126; //Male
class8.anInt200 = 14126; //Female
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable
class8.aString170 = "Moderator cape";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Its A moderator Cape".getBytes();
}
if(i == 13678) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anInt174 = 14127; //Inv & Ground
class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 14128; //Male
class8.anInt200 = 14128; //Female
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable
class8.aString170 = "Administrator cape";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Its an administrator cape".getBytes();
}
if(i == 13679) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anInt174 = 14129; //Inv & Ground
class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom
class8.anInt190 = 572;
class8.anInt198 = 0;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 14130; //Male
class8.anInt200 = 14130; //Female
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable
class8.aString170 = "Owner cape";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Its an owner cape".getBytes();
        }

So the IDs you need to add to capes are, 13677, 13678, 13679.
Notice you put 13697 instead of 13679.
[/quote]
Well I’ll be damned. it worked! now, my black party hat, it ins’t going into the right slot either? I did the same thing, mnade sure I got the code right too…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2009, 03:55:13 pm[/size][hr]I tryed adding my black partyhat(10108) to three different places:
int Gelm
int fullHelm
and int fullMask
and hat -.-[/quote]

Maybe it’s already listed somewhere else?
Try searching the ID and see if it comes up anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:10, topic:322165”][quote author=david7147 link=topic=418586.msg3076351#msg3076351 date=1261862419]

Have you got an item4.java?
Because you need to do the same for that if you have one.

No i don’t have that. That would be in my SOURCE ja? I have something called wearing, if that means anything
[/quote]

I don’t know, I’ve only ever really used Czar sources, all the crap that’s coming out today I don’t know how to use so, it’s down to you, that should’ve worked though, you sure you compiled and restarted correctly?[/quote]
Mhm, did it a few times TBH… But it still appears in my weapons slot :/[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2009, 03:33:56 pm[/size][hr][quote=“SilentCJ, post:10, topic:322165”][quote author=david7147 link=topic=418586.msg3076351#msg3076351 date=1261862419]

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:6, topic:322165”]…

Capture22.png948×493

Here, this is a picture of my item.java, notice I highlighted each of the item slots shown, notice, beneath each highlighted word, there is a huge list of numbers, which individually, are the item IDs of hundreds of different worn items.
You need to get the item IDs of the capes that you downloaded from my topic, and you need to add them IDs under the word capes, with all the other numbers, separated with a comma.[/quote]
Ahahaha you are awesome, thanks, i’m sorry i’m so stupid, but thanks
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2009, 03:10:41 pm[/size][hr]Hey it isn’t working

Capture22.png948×493

Here, this is a picture of my item.java, notice I highlighted each of the item slots shown, notice, beneath each highlighted word, there is a huge list of numbers, which individually, are the item IDs of hundreds of different worn items.
You need to get the item IDs of the capes that you downloaded from my topic, and you need to add them IDs under the word capes, with all the other numbers, separated with a comma.

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:4, topic:322165”]Look in your item.java, in there, there are sections where different types of items can be added into to make them appear in the correct slot, if you search for capes, you will see a list of IDs underneath, basically, just add the IDs of the capes in that list and they will appear in the correct slot in game.
Same goes for any other item, e.g gloves, just search gloves and repeat.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 26-12-2009, 20:50:21[/size][hr][quote author=david7147 link=topic=418586.msg3076316#msg3076316 date=1261860552]

Server side buddy.

Server side? Whats that. And why was it moved if it’s about models?
[/quote]

Because it’s to do with the server, not the client…[/quote]
Could you elaborate a bit more? Add the correct id of the cape and it will appear in the correct slot? I’m confused.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help(NOT WORKING)[edited]!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Look in your item.java, in there, there are sections where different types of items can be added into to make them appear in the correct slot, if you search for capes, you will see a list of IDs underneath, basically, just add the IDs of the capes in that list and they will appear in the correct slot in game.
Same goes for any other item, e.g gloves, just search gloves and repeat.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 26-12-2009, 20:50:21[/size][hr][quote=“david7147, post:3, topic:322165”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=418586.msg3076314#msg3076314 date=1261860487]
Server side buddy.
[/quote]
Server side? Whats that. And why was it moved if it’s about models? :P[/quote]

Because it’s to do with the server, not the client…

Read full topic
